Description:
Renovated Period Elegance In Smart Lifestyle Location
Nestled at the rear of tightly held "Castle Village", this Arthur Plaisted renovated Georgian inspired two-bedroom period apartment blends classical elegance with stylish modern living in a prestigious South Yarra position. Peaceful, private and surrounded by tranquil leafy views, it offers an exciting opportunity to enjoy inner city living in a unique setting of botanic beauty just a short stroll from Chapel Street, Toorak Village, Como Gardens, Como House, Rockley Gardens and transport.
Introduced by the group's magnificent landscaped gardens, a secure entry shared by only one other leads to this exceptional first floor domain. High ceilings, multi paned windows and rich early character distinguish an expansive, light filled layout featuring a generous sitting room with charming iron clad balcony, separate north facing dining and stone topped modern kitchen with sunny second balcony. Two bright bedrooms offer extensive custom robes/storage and share a stylish central bathroom, also with excellent storage.
Hydronic heating, split cooling, hardwood timber floors, intercom security and undercover parking enhance a delightful pied a terre that whilst providing privacy and exclusivity, places you just minutes from the boutiques, cafes, celebrated eateries and bars of Melbourne's most sought after lifestyle precinct.
Architecturally, Castle Village and Clyde flats are a well designed and detailed ensemble of American Colonial Revival buildings by renowned architect Arthur Plaisted (1940). The two buildings create a harmonious whole, united by their identical materials, roof types and massing in their original garden setting.
